channel.title: I'm new in java and want to learn it. Where should I start?
channel.description:
Title says it.. My achievement is -I made a "code" what says "My big brother is noob!" "Very noob!"
Don't flame me. I have no single idea where to start..

item.title: I'm new in java and want to learn it. Where should I start?
item.dc:creator: @Jei_Jei_KK Jei Jei KK
item.description:
@Jei_Jei_KK wrote:

Only thing in that, it looks messy to me.
I don’t like those clicky’s.

NO like!

blah(click here)
to learn blah(click here)

LIKE!

to learn blah;
blahblah.
...
...
blaa..
bleh.
@blah@

etc.

E: AARGH!!
I opened one of those, more clickys…
Then opened one of those clickys, it showed up new ones.

Read full topic
item.source: I'm new in java and want to learn it. Where should I start?

item.title: I'm new in java and want to learn it. Where should I start?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

If you have an interest in learning java, you would read something like that - and only with an interest will you succeed .

But if you really don’t, I’d recommend at least reading the initial chapters which discuss the syntax and format of java applications. Then, decide on a simple project and just try to do it using google as an aid. That’s really how I learned.

Read full topic

I really don’t want to read thing’s like that. They just won’t hit me.
I like hand-written, raw, “personal” text where you have your own opinions and such.

item.title: I'm new in java and want to learn it. Where should I start?
item.dc:creator: @d0yley d0yley
item.description:
@d0yley wrote:

Ok there is a lot of tutorials around one being the sun one which go’s into a lot of detail about everything if you want some help you can find me on irc, or pm me.

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/index.html
